text: Victor Oladipo is a monster. I remain blown away by his development.

Wendell Carter Jr. is going to be so dang good. He did a nice job overall tonight on switches against Harden and Paul. Carter is one of those players who doesn't need to score to make a positive impact.
I enjoy watching JaVale McGee play. Sure, he makes some frustrating mistakes. But he always plays hard; that's admirable, and it can't be said for all players. https://t.co/SqLys8CR8H

The Celtics and Sixers are both feeling growing pains as they incorporate Hayward and Fultz into the mix, but it’s a necessity. On the challenges finding balance for both contenders: @ringer @ringernba https://t.co/l4pLyZHq6r

Just watched Trae Young's 15 assist game. His feel is so advanced. Improved decision-making since college. Averaging 19.1 pts + 7.9 asts. All 12 rookies to ever drop over 18 & 5 won Rookie of the Year—except Magic, who lost to Bird. ROTY race will be wild. https://t.co/7ySmMKQczv

Domantas Sabonis improved so much as a passer at Gonzaga by cutting down on turnovers. The same thing is happening with the Pacers. It's been another impressive game for Sabonis tonight against the Rockets with quick, smart reads, and accurately delivered passes to teammates.

New @ringer NBA Show with @ChrisVernonShow on Jamal Murray and the Nuggets, the torrid Raptors, Utah's struggles, Duke draft preview, and way more. This was a fun show and we hit a lot of topics since, as @IsaacKLee once said, "Basketball is very good." https://t.co/jUhv9viBDO
R.J. Barrett has hit some really impressive layups tonight by both absorbing contact and finishing acrobatically.
I love the intensity that R.J. Barrett and Zion Williamson play with. This game is truly unbelievable to watch right now. Duke looks unstoppable.
Buy Zion Williamson stock while you still can. @ringer @ringernba https://t.co/5Vpet0ddbY

Zion Williamson’s gravity-defying dunks will lure you in, but the rest of his game will make you a believer in his potential. On @ZionW32's debut for @DukeMBB, which showcased his full repertoire of skills. @ringer @ringernba https://t.co/5Vpet0ddbY
Victor Oladipo handles a massive offensive load, yet it doesn't impact his defense. What a baller.
Oh my goodness at the dunk Domantas Sabonis just threw down. The Pacers are so, so fun.

Dario Saric was long overdue for a good game. The Sixers are a different team when he hits shots. I liked Brown going to the Simmons-Saric frontcourt in the third—a good way to get Fultz + Simmons time together. Really liking Shamet. Strong road win for the 76ers over the Pacers.

Karl-Anthony Towns is playing a strong two-way game so far against the Lakers. He's hitting shots, making good passes, trying on defense, blocking shots. The Wolves need more of this KAT. https://t.co/ppgcg7gNms

Just saw @mitskileaks live in LA at @wiltern. Truly a marvelous show. Go see Mitski on tour and listen to Be the Cowboy—one of the year’s best albums.

Also so good seeing @ringer’s @dannychau & @aherman2006 at the show. Now time to finish Lakers-Wolves... https://t.co/R3lMB7kqXt

The Celtics and Sixers are both feeling growing pains as they incorporate Hayward and Fultz into the mix. But it’s a necessity. On the challenges finding balance for both teams, from Monday on @ringer: https://t.co/l4pLyZHq6r
The next time someone says Frank Ntilikina is a bust, remind them that he is 20 and then send this video: https://t.co/UBuRlLjTzw
VILLAINS is an appropriate title for a supervillain like @SheaSerrano. Congratulations on the podcast, Shea. https://t.co/gwLN7bpZFB

New Ringer NBA Show with @dannychau and @JonathanTjarks on Zion Williamson, young two-guards breaking out, and more. This was recorded on Thursday, so we sadly couldn’t discuss the Bucks beating the Warriors... https://t.co/f2HyvOfjQa

Unreal. It's a necessary move for the 76ers, despite the risks (chemistry, on-court fit, Butler's free agency). But Jimmy Butler obviously raises their ceiling and increases their odds of making the NBA Finals. https://t.co/rDRwJ5ZZIH

Jimmy Butler's scoring and playmaking will enhance the Sixers offense and help their fourth quarter woes. But his fit with Embiid and Simmons isn't perfect. On how Butler and his new co-stars can mesh and what the 76ers front office should do next. @ringer https://t.co/iZcJbdNz4C

I'd start Landry Shamet moving forward. A lineup of Embiid, Simmons, Butler, Redick + Shamet provides the best balance of offense and defense. Let Fultz run the second unit. Chandler off the bench. Either way, the Sixers must find more depth: https://t.co/iZcJbdNz4C https://t.co/fNl1yGipqe

The Sixers blew a lead for the second consecutive game. But tonight they lost. Jimmy Butler should help them sustain more leads as one of the NBA's better late game scorers. But how can the 76ers best maximize Butler's fit with Embiid and Simmons? @ringer https://t.co/iZcJbdNz4C

De'Aaron Fox just hit a pull-up 3 then a step back 3 on consecutive possessions. He looks like an upgraded version of himself this season. The game is slowing down for him and he's making the tough passes he once made regularly at Kentucky. And his jumper has clearly improved.

Jimmy Butler's scoring and playmaking will enhance the Sixers offense and help their fourth quarter woes. But his fit with Embiid and Simmons isn't perfect. On how Butler and his new co-stars can mesh, plus what the front office should do next. @ringernba https://t.co/iZcJbdNz4C

The Caris LeVert injury is heartbreaking. One of the season’s brightest rising stars, already a very good two-way player who seemed to get better every game for the Nets. He’s battled thru foot injuries to get to this stage. Hoping for a smooth recovery so he can keep ascending.

The Montrezl Harrell Experience is a joy to watch. Love his effort, intensity, boards, and dunks. His defensive fundamentals have come a long way since Louisville. (Also, I hope more players begin to wear his style of headband. It's such a good look.) https://t.co/K3leNpEiQJ

That was such a fun yet helter-skelter final minute between the Clippers and Warriors with no timeouts breaking up the action. A little surprised Steve Kerr didn't call one on the last possession of regulation though.

Here’s a big check in on the progress NBA sophomores: De’Aaron Fox making a leap, Jayson Tatum launching midrange jumpers, Zach Collins playing out of his mind defense, and much more.  @ringer @ringernba https://t.co/apFn1irI06
Best news ever. Today is a good day. Also, the human body is wild. How does your leg bend like that and nothing gets broken? Truly amazing. https://t.co/e7fk5AiuGc

I saw Kevin Durant storm out of the locker room after the game. He looked annoyed and left quickly before it was open to media. Two reporters tried to stop him for an interview. He kept walking. KD only stopped briefly to shake hands with someone before exiting through the doors. https://t.co/tP8HIO1qjE
